39   _LOG_2PI = np.log(2 * np.pi)
40   _LOG_2 = np.log(2)

45   _doc_random_state = """\ 
46   seed : {None, int, np.random.RandomState, np.random.Generator}, optional 
47       Used for drawing random variates. 
48       If `seed` is `None`, the `~np.random.RandomState` singleton is used. 
49       If `seed` is an int, a new ``RandomState`` instance is used, seeded 
50       with seed. 
51       If `seed` is already a ``RandomState`` or ``Generator`` instance, 
52       then that object is used. 
53       Default is `None`.

57   def _squeeze_output(out):
58       """ 
59       Remove single-dimensional entries from array and convert to scalar, 
60       if necessary. 
61       """
62       out = out.squeeze()
63       if out.ndim == 0:
64           out = out[()]
65       return out
66   
67   
68   def _eigvalsh_to_eps(spectrum, cond=None, rcond=None):
69       """Determine which eigenvalues are "small" given the spectrum. 
70    
71       This is for compatibility across various linear algebra functions 
72       that should agree about whether or not a Hermitian matrix is numerically 
73       singular and what is its numerical matrix rank. 
74       This is designed to be compatible with scipy.linalg.pinvh. 
75    
76       Parameters 
77       ---------- 
78       spectrum : 1d ndarray 
79           Array of eigenvalues of a Hermitian matrix. 
80       cond, rcond : float, optional 
81           Cutoff for small eigenvalues. 
82           Singular values smaller than rcond * largest_eigenvalue are 
83           considered zero. 
84           If None or -1, suitable machine precision is used. 
85    
86       Returns 
87       ------- 
88       eps : float 
89           Magnitude cutoff for numerical negligibility. 
90    
91       """
92       if rcond is not None:
93           cond = rcond
94       if cond in [None, -1]:
95           t = spectrum.dtype.char.lower()
96           factor = {'f': 1E3, 'd': 1E6}
97           cond = factor[t] * np.finfo(t).eps
98       eps = cond * np.max(abs(spectrum))
99       return eps
100  
101  
102  def _pinv_1d(v, eps=1e-5):
103      """A helper function for computing the pseudoinverse. 
104   
105      Parameters 
106      ---------- 
107      v : iterable of numbers 
108          This may be thought of as a vector of eigenvalues or singular values. 
109      eps : float 
110          Values with magnitude no greater than eps are considered negligible. 
111   
112      Returns 
113      ------- 
114      v_pinv : 1d float ndarray 
115          A vector of pseudo-inverted numbers. 
116   
117      """
118      return np.array([0 if abs(x) <= eps else 1/x for x in v], dtype=float)
119  
120  
121  class _PSD:
122      """ 
123      Compute coordinated functions of a symmetric positive semidefinite matrix. 
124   
125      This class addresses two issues.  Firstly it allows the pseudoinverse, 
126      the logarithm of the pseudo-determinant, and the rank of the matrix 
127      to be computed using one call to eigh instead of three. 
128      Secondly it allows these functions to be computed in a way 
129      that gives mutually compatible results. 
130      All of the functions are computed with a common understanding as to 
131      which of the eigenvalues are to be considered negligibly small. 
132      The functions are designed to coordinate with scipy.linalg.pinvh() 
133      but not necessarily with np.linalg.det() or with np.linalg.matrix_rank(). 
134   
135      Parameters 
136      ---------- 
137      M : array_like 
138          Symmetric positive semidefinite matrix (2-D). 
139      cond, rcond : float, optional 
140          Cutoff for small eigenvalues. 
141          Singular values smaller than rcond * largest_eigenvalue are 
142          considered zero. 
143          If None or -1, suitable machine precision is used. 
144      lower : bool, optional 
145          Whether the pertinent array data is taken from the lower 
146          or upper triangle of M. (Default: lower) 
147      check_finite : bool, optional 
148          Whether to check that the input matrices contain only finite 
149          numbers. Disabling may give a performance gain, but may result 
150          in problems (crashes, non-termination) if the inputs do contain 
151          infinities or NaNs. 
152      allow_singular : bool, optional 
153          Whether to allow a singular matrix.  (Default: True) 
154   
155      Notes 
156      ----- 
157      The arguments are similar to those of scipy.linalg.pinvh(). 
158   
159      """
160  
161      def __init__(self, M, cond=None, rcond=None, lower=True,
162                   check_finite=True, allow_singular=True):
163          self._M = np.asarray(M)
164  
165          # Compute the symmetric eigendecomposition.
166          # Note that eigh takes care of array conversion, chkfinite,
167          # and assertion that the matrix is square.
168          s, u = scipy.linalg.eigh(M, lower=lower, check_finite=check_finite)
169  
170          eps = _eigvalsh_to_eps(s, cond, rcond)
171          if np.min(s) < -eps:
172              msg = "The input matrix must be symmetric positive semidefinite."
173              raise ValueError(msg)
174          d = s[s > eps]
175          if len(d) < len(s) and not allow_singular:
176              msg = ("When `allow_singular is False`, the input matrix must be "
177                     "symmetric positive definite.")
178              raise np.linalg.LinAlgError(msg)
179          s_pinv = _pinv_1d(s, eps)
180          U = np.multiply(u, np.sqrt(s_pinv))
181  
182          # Save the eigenvector basis, and tolerance for testing support
183          self.eps = 1e3*eps
184          self.V = u[:, s <= eps]
185  
186          # Initialize the eagerly precomputed attributes.
187          self.rank = len(d)
188          self.U = U
189          self.log_pdet = np.sum(np.log(d))
190  
191          # Initialize attributes to be lazily computed.
192          self._pinv = None
193  
194      def _support_mask(self, x):
195          """ 
196          Check whether x lies in the support of the distribution. 
197          """
198          residual = np.linalg.norm(x @ self.V, axis=-1)
199          in_support = residual < self.eps
200          return in_support
201  
202      @property
203      def pinv(self):
204          if self._pinv is None:
205              self._pinv = np.dot(self.U, self.U.T)
206          return self._pinv
207

209  class multi_rv_generic:
210      """ 
211      Class which encapsulates common functionality between all multivariate 
212      distributions. 
213      """
214      def __init__(self, seed=None):
215          super().__init__()
216          self._random_state = check_random_state(seed)
217  
218      @property
219      def random_state(self):
220          """ Get or set the Generator object for generating random variates. 
221   
222          If `seed` is None (or `np.random`), the `numpy.random.RandomState` 
223          singleton is used. 
224          If `seed` is an int, a new ``RandomState`` instance is used, 
225          seeded with `seed`. 
226          If `seed` is already a ``Generator`` or ``RandomState`` instance then 
227          that instance is used. 
228   
229          """
230          return self._random_state
231  
232      @random_state.setter
233      def random_state(self, seed):
234          self._random_state = check_random_state(seed)
235  
236      def _get_random_state(self, random_state):
237          if random_state is not None:
238              return check_random_state(random_state)
239          else:
240              return self._random_state
241  
242  
243  class multi_rv_frozen:
244      """ 
245      Class which encapsulates common functionality between all frozen 
246      multivariate distributions. 
247      """
248      @property
249      def random_state(self):
250          return self._dist._random_state
251  
252      @random_state.setter
253      def random_state(self, seed):
254          self._dist._random_state = check_random_state(seed)

257  _mvn_doc_default_callparams = """\ 
258  mean : array_like, default: ``[0]`` 
259      Mean of the distribution. 
260  cov : array_like or `Covariance`, default: ``[1]`` 
261      Symmetric positive (semi)definite covariance matrix of the distribution. 
262  allow_singular : bool, default: ``False`` 
263      Whether to allow a singular covariance matrix. This is ignored if `cov` is 
264      a `Covariance` object. 
265  """
266  
267  _mvn_doc_callparams_note = """\ 
268  Setting the parameter `mean` to `None` is equivalent to having `mean` 
269  be the zero-vector. The parameter `cov` can be a scalar, in which case 
270  the covariance matrix is the identity times that value, a vector of 
271  diagonal entries for the covariance matrix, a two-dimensional array_like, 
272  or a `Covariance` object. 
273  """

293  class multivariate_normal_gen(multi_rv_generic):
294      r"""A multivariate normal random variable. 
295   
296      The `mean` keyword specifies the mean. The `cov` keyword specifies the 
297      covariance matrix. 
298   
299      Methods 
300      ------- 
301      pdf(x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False) 
302          Probability density function. 
303      logpdf(x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False) 
304          Log of the probability density function. 
305      cdf(x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False, maxpts=1000000*dim, abseps=1e-5, releps=1e-5, lower_limit=None) 
306          Cumulative distribution function. 
307      logcdf(x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False, maxpts=1000000*dim, abseps=1e-5, releps=1e-5) 
308          Log of the cumulative distribution function. 
309      rvs(mean=None, cov=1, size=1, random_state=None) 
310          Draw random samples from a multivariate normal distribution. 
311      entropy(mean=None, cov=1) 
312          Compute the differential entropy of the multivariate normal. 
313      fit(x, fix_mean=None, fix_cov=None) 
314          Fit a multivariate normal distribution to data. 
315   
316      Parameters 
317      ---------- 
318      %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
319      %(_doc_random_state)s 
320   
321      Notes 
322      ----- 
323      %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
324   
325      The covariance matrix `cov` may be an instance of a subclass of 
326      `Covariance`, e.g. `scipy.stats.CovViaPrecision`. If so, `allow_singular` 
327      is ignored. 
328   
329      Otherwise, `cov` must be a symmetric positive semidefinite 
330      matrix when `allow_singular` is True; it must be (strictly) positive 
331      definite when `allow_singular` is False. 
332      Symmetry is not checked; only the lower triangular portion is used. 
333      The determinant and inverse of `cov` are computed 
334      as the pseudo-determinant and pseudo-inverse, respectively, so 
335      that `cov` does not need to have full rank. 
336   
337      The probability density function for `multivariate_normal` is 
338   
339      .. math:: 
340   
341          f(x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{(2 \pi)^k \det \Sigma}} 
342                 \exp\left( -\frac{1}{2} (x - \mu)^T \Sigma^{-1} (x - \mu) \right), 
343   
344      where :math:`\mu` is the mean, :math:`\Sigma` the covariance matrix, 
345      :math:`k` the rank of :math:`\Sigma`. In case of singular :math:`\Sigma`, 
346      SciPy extends this definition according to [1]_. 
347   
348      .. versionadded:: 0.14.0 
349   
350      References 
351      ---------- 
352      .. [1] Multivariate Normal Distribution - Degenerate Case, Wikipedia, 
353             https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multivariate_normal_distribution#Degenerate_case 
354   
355      Examples 
356      -------- 
357      >>> import numpy as np 
358      >>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt 
359      >>> from scipy.stats import multivariate_normal 
360   
361      >>> x = np.linspace(0, 5, 10, endpoint=False) 
362      >>> y = multivariate_normal.pdf(x, mean=2.5, cov=0.5); y 
363      array([ 0.00108914,  0.01033349,  0.05946514,  0.20755375,  0.43939129, 
364              0.56418958,  0.43939129,  0.20755375,  0.05946514,  0.01033349]) 
365      >>> fig1 = plt.figure() 
366      >>> ax = fig1.add_subplot(111) 
367      >>> ax.plot(x, y) 
368      >>> plt.show() 
369   
370      Alternatively, the object may be called (as a function) to fix the mean 
371      and covariance parameters, returning a "frozen" multivariate normal 
372      random variable: 
373   
374      >>> rv = multivariate_normal(mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False) 
375      >>> # Frozen object with the same methods but holding the given 
376      >>> # mean and covariance fixed. 
377   
378      The input quantiles can be any shape of array, as long as the last 
379      axis labels the components.  This allows us for instance to 
380      display the frozen pdf for a non-isotropic random variable in 2D as 
381      follows: 
382   
383      >>> x, y = np.mgrid[-1:1:.01, -1:1:.01] 
384      >>> pos = np.dstack((x, y)) 
385      >>> rv = multivariate_normal([0.5, -0.2], [[2.0, 0.3], [0.3, 0.5]]) 
386      >>> fig2 = plt.figure() 
387      >>> ax2 = fig2.add_subplot(111) 
388      >>> ax2.contourf(x, y, rv.pdf(pos)) 
389   
390      """  # noqa: E501
391  
392      def __init__(self, seed=None):
393          super().__init__(seed)
394          self.__doc__ = doccer.docformat(self.__doc__, mvn_docdict_params)
395  
396      def __call__(self, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False, seed=None):
397          """Create a frozen multivariate normal distribution. 
398   
399          See `multivariate_normal_frozen` for more information. 
400          """
401          return multivariate_normal_frozen(mean, cov,
402                                            allow_singular=allow_singular,
403                                            seed=seed)
404  
405      def _process_parameters(self, mean, cov, allow_singular=True):
406          """ 
407          Infer dimensionality from mean or covariance matrix, ensure that 
408          mean and covariance are full vector resp. matrix. 
409          """
410          if isinstance(cov, _covariance.Covariance):
411              return self._process_parameters_Covariance(mean, cov)
412          else:
413              # Before `Covariance` classes were introduced,
414              # `multivariate_normal` accepted plain arrays as `cov` and used the
415              # following input validation. To avoid disturbing the behavior of
416              # `multivariate_normal` when plain arrays are used, we use the
417              # original input validation here.
418              dim, mean, cov = self._process_parameters_psd(None, mean, cov)
419              # After input validation, some methods then processed the arrays
420              # with a `_PSD` object and used that to perform computation.
421              # To avoid branching statements in each method depending on whether
422              # `cov` is an array or `Covariance` object, we always process the
423              # array with `_PSD`, and then use wrapper that satisfies the
424              # `Covariance` interface, `CovViaPSD`.
425              psd = _PSD(cov, allow_singular=allow_singular)
426              cov_object = _covariance.CovViaPSD(psd)
427              return dim, mean, cov_object
428  
429      def _process_parameters_Covariance(self, mean, cov):
430          dim = cov.shape[-1]
431          mean = np.array([0.]) if mean is None else mean
432          message = (f"`cov` represents a covariance matrix in {dim} dimensions,"
433                     f"and so `mean` must be broadcastable to shape {(dim,)}")
434          try:
435              mean = np.broadcast_to(mean, dim)
436          except ValueError as e:
437              raise ValueError(message) from e
438          return dim, mean, cov
439  
440      def _process_parameters_psd(self, dim, mean, cov):
441          # Try to infer dimensionality
442          if dim is None:
443              if mean is None:
444                  if cov is None:
445                      dim = 1
446                  else:
447                      cov = np.asarray(cov, dtype=float)
448                      if cov.ndim < 2:
449                          dim = 1
450                      else:
451                          dim = cov.shape[0]
452              else:
453                  mean = np.asarray(mean, dtype=float)
454                  dim = mean.size
455          else:
456              if not np.isscalar(dim):
457                  raise ValueError("Dimension of random variable must be "
458                                   "a scalar.")
459  
460          # Check input sizes and return full arrays for mean and cov if
461          # necessary
462          if mean is None:
463              mean = np.zeros(dim)
464          mean = np.asarray(mean, dtype=float)
465  
466          if cov is None:
467              cov = 1.0
468          cov = np.asarray(cov, dtype=float)
469  
470          if dim == 1:
471              mean = mean.reshape(1)
472              cov = cov.reshape(1, 1)
473  
474          if mean.ndim != 1 or mean.shape[0] != dim:
475              raise ValueError("Array 'mean' must be a vector of length %d." %
476                               dim)
477          if cov.ndim == 0:
478              cov = cov * np.eye(dim)
479          elif cov.ndim == 1:
480              cov = np.diag(cov)
481          elif cov.ndim == 2 and cov.shape != (dim, dim):
482              rows, cols = cov.shape
483              if rows != cols:
484                  msg = ("Array 'cov' must be square if it is two dimensional,"
485                         f" but cov.shape = {str(cov.shape)}.")
486              else:
487                  msg = ("Dimension mismatch: array 'cov' is of shape %s,"
488                         " but 'mean' is a vector of length %d.")
489                  msg = msg % (str(cov.shape), len(mean))
490              raise ValueError(msg)
491          elif cov.ndim > 2:
492              raise ValueError("Array 'cov' must be at most two-dimensional,"
493                               " but cov.ndim = %d" % cov.ndim)
494  
495          return dim, mean, cov
496  
497      def _process_quantiles(self, x, dim):
498          """ 
499          Adjust quantiles array so that last axis labels the components of 
500          each data point. 
501          """
502          x = np.asarray(x, dtype=float)
503  
504          if x.ndim == 0:
505              x = x[np.newaxis]
506          elif x.ndim == 1:
507              if dim == 1:
508                  x = x[:, np.newaxis]
509              else:
510                  x = x[np.newaxis, :]
511  
512          return x
513  
514      def _logpdf(self, x, mean, cov_object):
515          """Log of the multivariate normal probability density function. 
516   
517          Parameters 
518          ---------- 
519          x : ndarray 
520              Points at which to evaluate the log of the probability 
521              density function 
522          mean : ndarray 
523              Mean of the distribution 
524          cov_object : Covariance 
525              An object representing the Covariance matrix 
526   
527          Notes 
528          ----- 
529          As this function does no argument checking, it should not be 
530          called directly; use 'logpdf' instead. 
531   
532          """
533          log_det_cov, rank = cov_object.log_pdet, cov_object.rank
534          dev = x - mean
535          if dev.ndim > 1:
536              log_det_cov = log_det_cov[..., np.newaxis]
537              rank = rank[..., np.newaxis]
538          maha = np.sum(np.square(cov_object.whiten(dev)), axis=-1)
539          return -0.5 * (rank * _LOG_2PI + log_det_cov + maha)
540  
541      def logpdf(self, x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False):
542          """Log of the multivariate normal probability density function. 
543   
544          Parameters 
545          ---------- 
546          x : array_like 
547              Quantiles, with the last axis of `x` denoting the components. 
548          %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
549   
550          Returns 
551          ------- 
552          pdf : ndarray or scalar 
553              Log of the probability density function evaluated at `x` 
554   
555          Notes 
556          ----- 
557          %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
558   
559          """
560          params = self._process_parameters(mean, cov, allow_singular)
561          dim, mean, cov_object = params
562          x = self._process_quantiles(x, dim)
563          out = self._logpdf(x, mean, cov_object)
564          if np.any(cov_object.rank < dim):
565              out_of_bounds = ~cov_object._support_mask(x-mean)
566              out[out_of_bounds] = -np.inf
567          return _squeeze_output(out)
568  
569      def pdf(self, x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False):
570          """Multivariate normal probability density function. 
571   
572          Parameters 
573          ---------- 
574          x : array_like 
575              Quantiles, with the last axis of `x` denoting the components. 
576          %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
577   
578          Returns 
579          ------- 
580          pdf : ndarray or scalar 
581              Probability density function evaluated at `x` 
582   
583          Notes 
584          ----- 
585          %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
586   
587          """
588          params = self._process_parameters(mean, cov, allow_singular)
589          dim, mean, cov_object = params
590          x = self._process_quantiles(x, dim)
591          out = np.exp(self._logpdf(x, mean, cov_object))
592          if np.any(cov_object.rank < dim):
593              out_of_bounds = ~cov_object._support_mask(x-mean)
594              out[out_of_bounds] = 0.0
595          return _squeeze_output(out)
596  
597      def _cdf(self, x, mean, cov, maxpts, abseps, releps, lower_limit):
598          """Multivariate normal cumulative distribution function. 
599   
600          Parameters 
601          ---------- 
602          x : ndarray 
603              Points at which to evaluate the cumulative distribution function. 
604          mean : ndarray 
605              Mean of the distribution 
606          cov : array_like 
607              Covariance matrix of the distribution 
608          maxpts : integer 
609              The maximum number of points to use for integration 
610          abseps : float 
611              Absolute error tolerance 
612          releps : float 
613              Relative error tolerance 
614          lower_limit : array_like, optional 
615              Lower limit of integration of the cumulative distribution function. 
616              Default is negative infinity. Must be broadcastable with `x`. 
617   
618          Notes 
619          ----- 
620          As this function does no argument checking, it should not be 
621          called directly; use 'cdf' instead. 
622   
623   
624          .. versionadded:: 1.0.0 
625   
626          """
627          lower = (np.full(mean.shape, -np.inf)
628                   if lower_limit is None else lower_limit)
629          # In 2d, _mvn.mvnun accepts input in which `lower` bound elements
630          # are greater than `x`. Not so in other dimensions. Fix this by
631          # ensuring that lower bounds are indeed lower when passed, then
632          # set signs of resulting CDF manually.
633          b, a = np.broadcast_arrays(x, lower)
634          i_swap = b < a
635          signs = (-1)**(i_swap.sum(axis=-1))  # odd # of swaps -> negative
636          a, b = a.copy(), b.copy()
637          a[i_swap], b[i_swap] = b[i_swap], a[i_swap]
638          n = x.shape[-1]
639          limits = np.concatenate((a, b), axis=-1)
640  
641          # mvnun expects 1-d arguments, so process points sequentially
642          def func1d(limits):
643              with MVN_LOCK:
644                  return _mvn.mvnun(limits[:n], limits[n:], mean, cov,
645                                  maxpts, abseps, releps)[0]
646  
647          out = np.apply_along_axis(func1d, -1, limits) * signs
648          return _squeeze_output(out)
649  
650      def logcdf(self, x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False, maxpts=None,
651                 abseps=1e-5, releps=1e-5, *, lower_limit=None):
652          """Log of the multivariate normal cumulative distribution function. 
653   
654          Parameters 
655          ---------- 
656          x : array_like 
657              Quantiles, with the last axis of `x` denoting the components. 
658          %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
659          maxpts : integer, optional 
660              The maximum number of points to use for integration 
661              (default ``1000000*dim``) 
662          abseps : float, optional 
663              Absolute error tolerance (default 1e-5) 
664          releps : float, optional 
665              Relative error tolerance (default 1e-5) 
666          lower_limit : array_like, optional 
667              Lower limit of integration of the cumulative distribution function. 
668              Default is negative infinity. Must be broadcastable with `x`. 
669   
670          Returns 
671          ------- 
672          cdf : ndarray or scalar 
673              Log of the cumulative distribution function evaluated at `x` 
674   
675          Notes 
676          ----- 
677          %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
678   
679          .. versionadded:: 1.0.0 
680   
681          """
682          params = self._process_parameters(mean, cov, allow_singular)
683          dim, mean, cov_object = params
684          cov = cov_object.covariance
685          x = self._process_quantiles(x, dim)
686          if not maxpts:
687              maxpts = 1000000 * dim
688          cdf = self._cdf(x, mean, cov, maxpts, abseps, releps, lower_limit)
689          # the log of a negative real is complex, and cdf can be negative
690          # if lower limit is greater than upper limit
691          cdf = cdf + 0j if np.any(cdf < 0) else cdf
692          out = np.log(cdf)
693          return out
694  
695      def cdf(self, x, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False, maxpts=None,
696              abseps=1e-5, releps=1e-5, *, lower_limit=None):
697          """Multivariate normal cumulative distribution function. 
698   
699          Parameters 
700          ---------- 
701          x : array_like 
702              Quantiles, with the last axis of `x` denoting the components. 
703          %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
704          maxpts : integer, optional 
705              The maximum number of points to use for integration 
706              (default ``1000000*dim``) 
707          abseps : float, optional 
708              Absolute error tolerance (default 1e-5) 
709          releps : float, optional 
710              Relative error tolerance (default 1e-5) 
711          lower_limit : array_like, optional 
712              Lower limit of integration of the cumulative distribution function. 
713              Default is negative infinity. Must be broadcastable with `x`. 
714   
715          Returns 
716          ------- 
717          cdf : ndarray or scalar 
718              Cumulative distribution function evaluated at `x` 
719   
720          Notes 
721          ----- 
722          %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
723   
724          .. versionadded:: 1.0.0 
725   
726          """
727          params = self._process_parameters(mean, cov, allow_singular)
728          dim, mean, cov_object = params
729          cov = cov_object.covariance
730          x = self._process_quantiles(x, dim)
731          if not maxpts:
732              maxpts = 1000000 * dim
733          out = self._cdf(x, mean, cov, maxpts, abseps, releps, lower_limit)
734          return out
735  
736      def rvs(self, mean=None, cov=1, size=1, random_state=None):
737          """Draw random samples from a multivariate normal distribution. 
738   
739          Parameters 
740          ---------- 
741          %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
742          size : integer, optional 
743              Number of samples to draw (default 1). 
744          %(_doc_random_state)s 
745   
746          Returns 
747          ------- 
748          rvs : ndarray or scalar 
749              Random variates of size (`size`, `N`), where `N` is the 
750              dimension of the random variable. 
751   
752          Notes 
753          ----- 
754          %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
755   
756          """
757          dim, mean, cov_object = self._process_parameters(mean, cov)
758          random_state = self._get_random_state(random_state)
759  
760          if isinstance(cov_object, _covariance.CovViaPSD):
761              cov = cov_object.covariance
762              out = random_state.multivariate_normal(mean, cov, size)
763              out = _squeeze_output(out)
764          else:
765              size = size or tuple()
766              if not np.iterable(size):
767                  size = (size,)
768              shape = tuple(size) + (cov_object.shape[-1],)
769              x = random_state.normal(size=shape)
770              out = mean + cov_object.colorize(x)
771          return out
772  
773      def entropy(self, mean=None, cov=1):
774          """Compute the differential entropy of the multivariate normal. 
775   
776          Parameters 
777          ---------- 
778          %(_mvn_doc_default_callparams)s 
779   
780          Returns 
781          ------- 
782          h : scalar 
783              Entropy of the multivariate normal distribution 
784   
785          Notes 
786          ----- 
787          %(_mvn_doc_callparams_note)s 
788   
789          """
790          dim, mean, cov_object = self._process_parameters(mean, cov)
791          return 0.5 * (cov_object.rank * (_LOG_2PI + 1) + cov_object.log_pdet)
792  
793      def fit(self, x, fix_mean=None, fix_cov=None):
794          """Fit a multivariate normal distribution to data. 
795   
796          Parameters 
797          ---------- 
798          x : ndarray (m, n) 
799              Data the distribution is fitted to. Must have two axes. 
800              The first axis of length `m` represents the number of vectors 
801              the distribution is fitted to. The second axis of length `n` 
802              determines the dimensionality of the fitted distribution. 
803          fix_mean : ndarray(n, ) 
804              Fixed mean vector. Must have length `n`. 
805          fix_cov: ndarray (n, n) 
806              Fixed covariance matrix. Must have shape ``(n, n)``. 
807   
808          Returns 
809          ------- 
810          mean : ndarray (n, ) 
811              Maximum likelihood estimate of the mean vector 
812          cov : ndarray (n, n) 
813              Maximum likelihood estimate of the covariance matrix 
814   
815          """
816          # input validation for data to be fitted
817          x = np.asarray(x)
818          if x.ndim != 2:
819              raise ValueError("`x` must be two-dimensional.")
820  
821          n_vectors, dim = x.shape
822  
823          # parameter estimation
824          # reference: https://home.ttic.edu/~shubhendu/Slides/Estimation.pdf
825          if fix_mean is not None:
826              # input validation for `fix_mean`
827              fix_mean = np.atleast_1d(fix_mean)
828              if fix_mean.shape != (dim, ):
829                  msg = ("`fix_mean` must be a one-dimensional array the same "
830                         "length as the dimensionality of the vectors `x`.")
831                  raise ValueError(msg)
832              mean = fix_mean
833          else:
834              mean = x.mean(axis=0)
835  
836          if fix_cov is not None:
837              # input validation for `fix_cov`
838              fix_cov = np.atleast_2d(fix_cov)
839              # validate shape
840              if fix_cov.shape != (dim, dim):
841                  msg = ("`fix_cov` must be a two-dimensional square array "
842                         "of same side length as the dimensionality of the "
843                         "vectors `x`.")
844                  raise ValueError(msg)
845              # validate positive semidefiniteness
846              # a trimmed down copy from _PSD
847              s, u = scipy.linalg.eigh(fix_cov, lower=True, check_finite=True)
848              eps = _eigvalsh_to_eps(s)
849              if np.min(s) < -eps:
850                  msg = "`fix_cov` must be symmetric positive semidefinite."
851                  raise ValueError(msg)
852              cov = fix_cov
853          else:
854              centered_data = x - mean
855              cov = centered_data.T @ centered_data / n_vectors
856          return mean, cov
857  
858  
859  multivariate_normal = multivariate_normal_gen()
860  
861  
862  class multivariate_normal_frozen(multi_rv_frozen):
863      def __init__(self, mean=None, cov=1, allow_singular=False, seed=None,
864                   maxpts=None, abseps=1e-5, releps=1e-5):
865          """Create a frozen multivariate normal distribution. 
866   
867          Parameters 
868          ---------- 
869          mean : array_like, default: ``[0]`` 
870              Mean of the distribution. 
871          cov : array_like, default: ``[1]`` 
872              Symmetric positive (semi)definite covariance matrix of the 
873              distribution. 
874          allow_singular : bool, default: ``False`` 
875              Whether to allow a singular covariance matrix. 
876          seed : {None, int, `numpy.random.Generator`, `numpy.random.RandomState`}, optional 
877              If `seed` is None (or `np.random`), the `numpy.random.RandomState` 
878              singleton is used. 
879              If `seed` is an int, a new ``RandomState`` instance is used, 
880              seeded with `seed`. 
881              If `seed` is already a ``Generator`` or ``RandomState`` instance 
882              then that instance is used. 
883          maxpts : integer, optional 
884              The maximum number of points to use for integration of the 
885              cumulative distribution function (default ``1000000*dim``) 
886          abseps : float, optional 
887              Absolute error tolerance for the cumulative distribution function 
888              (default 1e-5) 
889          releps : float, optional 
890              Relative error tolerance for the cumulative distribution function 
891              (default 1e-5) 
892   
893          Examples 
894          -------- 
895          When called with the default parameters, this will create a 1D random 
896          variable with mean 0 and covariance 1: 
897   
898          >>> from scipy.stats import multivariate_normal 
899          >>> r = multivariate_normal() 
900          >>> r.mean 
901          array([ 0.]) 
902          >>> r.cov 
903          array([[1.]]) 
904   
905          """ # numpy/numpydoc#87  # noqa: E501
906          self._dist = multivariate_normal_gen(seed)
907          self.dim, self.mean, self.cov_object = (
908              self._dist._process_parameters(mean, cov, allow_singular))
909          self.allow_singular = allow_singular or self.cov_object._allow_singular
910          if not maxpts:
911              maxpts = 1000000 * self.dim
912          self.maxpts = maxpts
913          self.abseps = abseps
914          self.releps = releps
915  
916      @property
917      def cov(self):
918          return self.cov_object.covariance
919  
920      def logpdf(self, x):
921          x = self._dist._process_quantiles(x, self.dim)
922          out = self._dist._logpdf(x, self.mean, self.cov_object)
923          if np.any(self.cov_object.rank < self.dim):
924              out_of_bounds = ~self.cov_object._support_mask(x-self.mean)
925              out[out_of_bounds] = -np.inf
926          return _squeeze_output(out)
927  
928      def pdf(self, x):
929          return np.exp(self.logpdf(x))
930  
931      def logcdf(self, x, *, lower_limit=None):
932          cdf = self.cdf(x, lower_limit=lower_limit)
933          # the log of a negative real is complex, and cdf can be negative
934          # if lower limit is greater than upper limit
935          cdf = cdf + 0j if np.any(cdf < 0) else cdf
936          out = np.log(cdf)
937          return out
938  
939      def cdf(self, x, *, lower_limit=None):
940          x = self._dist._process_quantiles(x, self.dim)
941          out = self._dist._cdf(x, self.mean, self.cov_object.covariance,
942                                self.maxpts, self.abseps, self.releps,
943                                lower_limit)
944          return _squeeze_output(out)
945  
946      def rvs(self, size=1, random_state=None):
947          return self._dist.rvs(self.mean, self.cov_object, size, random_state)
948  
949      def entropy(self):
950          """Computes the differential entropy of the multivariate normal. 
951   
952          Returns 
953          ------- 
954          h : scalar 
955              Entropy of the multivariate normal distribution 
956   
957          """
958          log_pdet = self.cov_object.log_pdet
959          rank = self.cov_object.rank
960          return 0.5 * (rank * (_LOG_2PI + 1) + log_pdet)
961  
962  
963  # Set frozen generator docstrings from corresponding docstrings in
964  # multivariate_normal_gen and fill in default strings in class docstrings
965  for name in ['logpdf', 'pdf', 'logcdf', 'cdf', 'rvs']:
966      method = multivariate_normal_gen.__dict__[name]
967      method_frozen = multivariate_normal_frozen.__dict__[name]
968      method_frozen.__doc__ = doccer.docformat(method.__doc__,
969                                               mvn_docdict_noparams)
970      method.__doc__ = doccer.docformat(method.__doc__, mvn_docdict_params)

982  If `mean` is set to `None` then a matrix of zeros is used for the mean. 
983  The dimensions of this matrix are inferred from the shape of `rowcov` and 
984  `colcov`, if these are provided, or set to ``1`` if ambiguous. 
985   
986  `rowcov` and `colcov` can be two-dimensional array_likes specifying the 
987  covariance matrices directly. Alternatively, a one-dimensional array will 
988  be be interpreted as the entries of a diagonal matrix, and a scalar or 
989  zero-dimensional array will be interpreted as this value times the 
990  identity matrix. 
991  """

1010 
1011 class matrix_normal_gen(multi_rv_generic):
1012     r"""A matrix normal random variable. 
1013  
1014     The `mean` keyword specifies the mean. The `rowcov` keyword specifies the 
1015     among-row covariance matrix. The 'colcov' keyword specifies the 
1016     among-column covariance matrix. 
1017  
1018     Methods 
1019     ------- 
1020     pdf(X, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1) 
1021         Probability density function. 
1022     logpdf(X, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1) 
1023         Log of the probability density function. 
1024     rvs(mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1, size=1, random_state=None) 
1025         Draw random samples. 
1026     entropy(rowcol=1, colcov=1) 
1027         Differential entropy. 
1028  
1029     Parameters 
1030     ---------- 
1031     %(_matnorm_doc_default_callparams)s 
1032     %(_doc_random_state)s 
1033  
1034     Notes 
1035     ----- 
1036     %(_matnorm_doc_callparams_note)s 
1037  
1038     The covariance matrices specified by `rowcov` and `colcov` must be 
1039     (symmetric) positive definite. If the samples in `X` are 
1040     :math:`m \times n`, then `rowcov` must be :math:`m \times m` and 
1041     `colcov` must be :math:`n \times n`. `mean` must be the same shape as `X`. 
1042  
1043     The probability density function for `matrix_normal` is 
1044  
1045     .. math:: 
1046  
1047         f(X) = (2 \pi)^{-\frac{mn}{2}}|U|^{-\frac{n}{2}} |V|^{-\frac{m}{2}} 
1048                \exp\left( -\frac{1}{2} \mathrm{Tr}\left[ U^{-1} (X-M) V^{-1} 
1049                (X-M)^T \right] \right), 
1050  
1051     where :math:`M` is the mean, :math:`U` the among-row covariance matrix, 
1052     :math:`V` the among-column covariance matrix. 
1053  
1054     The `allow_singular` behaviour of the `multivariate_normal` 
1055     distribution is not currently supported. Covariance matrices must be 
1056     full rank. 
1057  
1058     The `matrix_normal` distribution is closely related to the 
1059     `multivariate_normal` distribution. Specifically, :math:`\mathrm{Vec}(X)` 
1060     (the vector formed by concatenating the columns  of :math:`X`) has a 
1061     multivariate normal distribution with mean :math:`\mathrm{Vec}(M)` 
1062     and covariance :math:`V \otimes U` (where :math:`\otimes` is the Kronecker 
1063     product). Sampling and pdf evaluation are 
1064     :math:`\mathcal{O}(m^3 + n^3 + m^2 n + m n^2)` for the matrix normal, but 
1065     :math:`\mathcal{O}(m^3 n^3)` for the equivalent multivariate normal, 
1066     making this equivalent form algorithmically inefficient. 
1067  
1068     .. versionadded:: 0.17.0 
1069  
1070     Examples 
1071     -------- 
1072  
1073     >>> import numpy as np 
1074     >>> from scipy.stats import matrix_normal 
1075  
1076     >>> M = np.arange(6).reshape(3,2); M 
1077     array([[0, 1], 
1078            [2, 3], 
1079            [4, 5]]) 
1080     >>> U = np.diag([1,2,3]); U 
1081     array([[1, 0, 0], 
1082            [0, 2, 0], 
1083            [0, 0, 3]]) 
1084     >>> V = 0.3*np.identity(2); V 
1085     array([[ 0.3,  0. ], 
1086            [ 0. ,  0.3]]) 
1087     >>> X = M + 0.1; X 
1088     array([[ 0.1,  1.1], 
1089            [ 2.1,  3.1], 
1090            [ 4.1,  5.1]]) 
1091     >>> matrix_normal.pdf(X, mean=M, rowcov=U, colcov=V) 
1092     0.023410202050005054 
1093  
1094     >>> # Equivalent multivariate normal 
1095     >>> from scipy.stats import multivariate_normal 
1096     >>> vectorised_X = X.T.flatten() 
1097     >>> equiv_mean = M.T.flatten() 
1098     >>> equiv_cov = np.kron(V,U) 
1099     >>> multivariate_normal.pdf(vectorised_X, mean=equiv_mean, cov=equiv_cov) 
1100     0.023410202050005054 
1101  
1102     Alternatively, the object may be called (as a function) to fix the mean 
1103     and covariance parameters, returning a "frozen" matrix normal 
1104     random variable: 
1105  
1106     >>> rv = matrix_normal(mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1) 
1107     >>> # Frozen object with the same methods but holding the given 
1108     >>> # mean and covariance fixed. 
1109  
1110     """
1111 
1112     def __init__(self, seed=None):
1113         super().__init__(seed)
1114         self.__doc__ = doccer.docformat(self.__doc__, matnorm_docdict_params)
1115 
1116     def __call__(self, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1, seed=None):
1117         """Create a frozen matrix normal distribution. 
1118  
1119         See `matrix_normal_frozen` for more information. 
1120  
1121         """
1122         return matrix_normal_frozen(mean, rowcov, colcov, seed=seed)
1123 
1124     def _process_parameters(self, mean, rowcov, colcov):
1125         """ 
1126         Infer dimensionality from mean or covariance matrices. Handle 
1127         defaults. Ensure compatible dimensions. 
1128         """
1129 
1130         # Process mean
1131         if mean is not None:
1132             mean = np.asarray(mean, dtype=float)
1133             meanshape = mean.shape
1134             if len(meanshape) != 2:
1135                 raise ValueError("Array `mean` must be two dimensional.")
1136             if np.any(meanshape == 0):
1137                 raise ValueError("Array `mean` has invalid shape.")
1138 
1139         # Process among-row covariance
1140         rowcov = np.asarray(rowcov, dtype=float)
1141         if rowcov.ndim == 0:
1142             if mean is not None:
1143                 rowcov = rowcov * np.identity(meanshape[0])
1144             else:
1145                 rowcov = rowcov * np.identity(1)
1146         elif rowcov.ndim == 1:
1147             rowcov = np.diag(rowcov)
1148         rowshape = rowcov.shape
1149         if len(rowshape) != 2:
1150             raise ValueError("`rowcov` must be a scalar or a 2D array.")
1151         if rowshape[0] != rowshape[1]:
1152             raise ValueError("Array `rowcov` must be square.")
1153         if rowshape[0] == 0:
1154             raise ValueError("Array `rowcov` has invalid shape.")
1155         numrows = rowshape[0]
1156 
1157         # Process among-column covariance
1158         colcov = np.asarray(colcov, dtype=float)
1159         if colcov.ndim == 0:
1160             if mean is not None:
1161                 colcov = colcov * np.identity(meanshape[1])
1162             else:
1163                 colcov = colcov * np.identity(1)
1164         elif colcov.ndim == 1:
1165             colcov = np.diag(colcov)
1166         colshape = colcov.shape
1167         if len(colshape) != 2:
1168             raise ValueError("`colcov` must be a scalar or a 2D array.")
1169         if colshape[0] != colshape[1]:
1170             raise ValueError("Array `colcov` must be square.")
1171         if colshape[0] == 0:
1172             raise ValueError("Array `colcov` has invalid shape.")
1173         numcols = colshape[0]
1174 
1175         # Ensure mean and covariances compatible
1176         if mean is not None:
1177             if meanshape[0] != numrows:
1178                 raise ValueError("Arrays `mean` and `rowcov` must have the "
1179                                  "same number of rows.")
1180             if meanshape[1] != numcols:
1181                 raise ValueError("Arrays `mean` and `colcov` must have the "
1182                                  "same number of columns.")
1183         else:
1184             mean = np.zeros((numrows, numcols))
1185 
1186         dims = (numrows, numcols)
1187 
1188         return dims, mean, rowcov, colcov
1189 
1190     def _process_quantiles(self, X, dims):
1191         """ 
1192         Adjust quantiles array so that last two axes labels the components of 
1193         each data point. 
1194         """
1195         X = np.asarray(X, dtype=float)
1196         if X.ndim == 2:
1197             X = X[np.newaxis, :]
1198         if X.shape[-2:] != dims:
1199             raise ValueError("The shape of array `X` is not compatible "
1200                              "with the distribution parameters.")
1201         return X
1202 
1203     def _logpdf(self, dims, X, mean, row_prec_rt, log_det_rowcov,
1204                 col_prec_rt, log_det_colcov):
1205         """Log of the matrix normal probability density function. 
1206  
1207         Parameters 
1208         ---------- 
1209         dims : tuple 
1210             Dimensions of the matrix variates 
1211         X : ndarray 
1212             Points at which to evaluate the log of the probability 
1213             density function 
1214         mean : ndarray 
1215             Mean of the distribution 
1216         row_prec_rt : ndarray 
1217             A decomposition such that np.dot(row_prec_rt, row_prec_rt.T) 
1218             is the inverse of the among-row covariance matrix 
1219         log_det_rowcov : float 
1220             Logarithm of the determinant of the among-row covariance matrix 
1221         col_prec_rt : ndarray 
1222             A decomposition such that np.dot(col_prec_rt, col_prec_rt.T) 
1223             is the inverse of the among-column covariance matrix 
1224         log_det_colcov : float 
1225             Logarithm of the determinant of the among-column covariance matrix 
1226  
1227         Notes 
1228         ----- 
1229         As this function does no argument checking, it should not be 
1230         called directly; use 'logpdf' instead. 
1231  
1232         """
1233         numrows, numcols = dims
1234         roll_dev = np.moveaxis(X-mean, -1, 0)
1235         scale_dev = np.tensordot(col_prec_rt.T,
1236                                  np.dot(roll_dev, row_prec_rt), 1)
1237         maha = np.sum(np.sum(np.square(scale_dev), axis=-1), axis=0)
1238         return -0.5 * (numrows*numcols*_LOG_2PI + numcols*log_det_rowcov
1239                        + numrows*log_det_colcov + maha)
1240 
1241     def logpdf(self, X, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1):
1242         """Log of the matrix normal probability density function. 
1243  
1244         Parameters 
1245         ---------- 
1246         X : array_like 
1247             Quantiles, with the last two axes of `X` denoting the components. 
1248         %(_matnorm_doc_default_callparams)s 
1249  
1250         Returns 
1251         ------- 
1252         logpdf : ndarray 
1253             Log of the probability density function evaluated at `X` 
1254  
1255         Notes 
1256         ----- 
1257         %(_matnorm_doc_callparams_note)s 
1258  
1259         """
1260         dims, mean, rowcov, colcov = self._process_parameters(mean, rowcov,
1261                                                               colcov)
1262         X = self._process_quantiles(X, dims)
1263         rowpsd = _PSD(rowcov, allow_singular=False)
1264         colpsd = _PSD(colcov, allow_singular=False)
1265         out = self._logpdf(dims, X, mean, rowpsd.U, rowpsd.log_pdet, colpsd.U,
1266                            colpsd.log_pdet)
1267         return _squeeze_output(out)
1268 
1269     def pdf(self, X, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1):
1270         """Matrix normal probability density function. 
1271  
1272         Parameters 
1273         ---------- 
1274         X : array_like 
1275             Quantiles, with the last two axes of `X` denoting the components. 
1276         %(_matnorm_doc_default_callparams)s 
1277  
1278         Returns 
1279         ------- 
1280         pdf : ndarray 
1281             Probability density function evaluated at `X` 
1282  
1283         Notes 
1284         ----- 
1285         %(_matnorm_doc_callparams_note)s 
1286  
1287         """
1288         return np.exp(self.logpdf(X, mean, rowcov, colcov))
1289 
1290     def rvs(self, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1, size=1, random_state=None):
1291         """Draw random samples from a matrix normal distribution. 
1292  
1293         Parameters 
1294         ---------- 
1295         %(_matnorm_doc_default_callparams)s 
1296         size : integer, optional 
1297             Number of samples to draw (default 1). 
1298         %(_doc_random_state)s 
1299  
1300         Returns 
1301         ------- 
1302         rvs : ndarray or scalar 
1303             Random variates of size (`size`, `dims`), where `dims` is the 
1304             dimension of the random matrices. 
1305  
1306         Notes 
1307         ----- 
1308         %(_matnorm_doc_callparams_note)s 
1309  
1310         """
1311         size = int(size)
1312         dims, mean, rowcov, colcov = self._process_parameters(mean, rowcov,
1313                                                               colcov)
1314         rowchol = scipy.linalg.cholesky(rowcov, lower=True)
1315         colchol = scipy.linalg.cholesky(colcov, lower=True)
1316         random_state = self._get_random_state(random_state)
1317         # We aren't generating standard normal variates with size=(size,
1318         # dims[0], dims[1]) directly to ensure random variates remain backwards
1319         # compatible. See https://github.com/scipy/scipy/pull/12312 for more
1320         # details.
1321         std_norm = random_state.standard_normal(
1322             size=(dims[1], size, dims[0])
1323         ).transpose(1, 2, 0)
1324         out = mean + np.einsum('jp,ipq,kq->ijk',
1325                                rowchol, std_norm, colchol,
1326                                optimize=True)
1327         if size == 1:
1328             out = out.reshape(mean.shape)
1329         return out
1330 
1331     def entropy(self, rowcov=1, colcov=1):
1332         """Log of the matrix normal probability density function. 
1333  
1334         Parameters 
1335         ---------- 
1336         rowcov : array_like, optional 
1337             Among-row covariance matrix of the distribution (default: ``1``) 
1338         colcov : array_like, optional 
1339             Among-column covariance matrix of the distribution (default: ``1``) 
1340  
1341         Returns 
1342         ------- 
1343         entropy : float 
1344             Entropy of the distribution 
1345  
1346         Notes 
1347         ----- 
1348         %(_matnorm_doc_callparams_note)s 
1349  
1350         """
1351         dummy_mean = np.zeros((rowcov.shape[0], colcov.shape[0]))
1352         dims, _, rowcov, colcov = self._process_parameters(dummy_mean,
1353                                                            rowcov,
1354                                                            colcov)
1355         rowpsd = _PSD(rowcov, allow_singular=False)
1356         colpsd = _PSD(colcov, allow_singular=False)
1357 
1358         return self._entropy(dims, rowpsd.log_pdet, colpsd.log_pdet)
1359 
1360     def _entropy(self, dims, row_cov_logdet, col_cov_logdet):
1361         n, p = dims
1362         return (0.5 * n * p * (1 + _LOG_2PI) + 0.5 * p * row_cov_logdet +
1363                 0.5 * n * col_cov_logdet)
1364 
1365 
1366 matrix_normal = matrix_normal_gen()
1367 
1368 
1369 class matrix_normal_frozen(multi_rv_frozen):
1370     """ 
1371     Create a frozen matrix normal distribution. 
1372  
1373     Parameters 
1374     ---------- 
1375     %(_matnorm_doc_default_callparams)s 
1376     seed : {None, int, `numpy.random.Generator`, `numpy.random.RandomState`}, optional 
1377         If `seed` is `None` the `~np.random.RandomState` singleton is used. 
1378         If `seed` is an int, a new ``RandomState`` instance is used, seeded 
1379         with seed. 
1380         If `seed` is already a ``RandomState`` or ``Generator`` instance, 
1381         then that object is used. 
1382         Default is `None`. 
1383  
1384     Examples 
1385     -------- 
1386     >>> import numpy as np 
1387     >>> from scipy.stats import matrix_normal 
1388  
1389     >>> distn = matrix_normal(mean=np.zeros((3,3))) 
1390     >>> X = distn.rvs(); X 
1391     array([[-0.02976962,  0.93339138, -0.09663178], 
1392            [ 0.67405524,  0.28250467, -0.93308929], 
1393            [-0.31144782,  0.74535536,  1.30412916]]) 
1394     >>> distn.pdf(X) 
1395     2.5160642368346784e-05 
1396     >>> distn.logpdf(X) 
1397     -10.590229595124615 
1398     """
1399 
1400     def __init__(self, mean=None, rowcov=1, colcov=1, seed=None):
1401         self._dist = matrix_normal_gen(seed)
1402         self.dims, self.mean, self.rowcov, self.colcov = \
1403             self._dist._process_parameters(mean, rowcov, colcov)
1404         self.rowpsd = _PSD(self.rowcov, allow_singular=False)
1405         self.colpsd = _PSD(self.colcov, allow_singular=False)
1406 
1407     def logpdf(self, X):
1408         X = self._dist._process_quantiles(X, self.dims)
1409         out = self._dist._logpdf(self.dims, X, self.mean, self.rowpsd.U,
1410                                  self.rowpsd.log_pdet, self.colpsd.U,
1411                                  self.colpsd.log_pdet)
1412         return _squeeze_output(out)
1413 
1414     def pdf(self, X):
1415         return np.exp(self.logpdf(X))
1416 
1417     def rvs(self, size=1, random_state=None):
1418         return self._dist.rvs(self.mean, self.rowcov, self.colcov, size,
1419                               random_state)
1420 
1421     def entropy(self):
1422         return self._dist._entropy(self.dims, self.rowpsd.log_pdet,
1423                                    self.colpsd.log_pdet)
1424

1435 _dirichlet_doc_default_callparams = """\ 
1436 alpha : array_like 
1437     The concentration parameters. The number of entries determines the 
1438     dimensionality of the distribution. 
1439 """
1440 _dirichlet_doc_frozen_callparams = ""
1441

1443 See class definition for a detailed description of parameters."""
1444 
1445 dirichlet_docdict_params = {
1446     '_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams': _dirichlet_doc_default_callparams,
1447     '_doc_random_state': _doc_random_state
1448 }
1449 
1450 dirichlet_docdict_noparams = {
1451     '_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams': _dirichlet_doc_frozen_callparams,
1452     '_doc_random_state': _doc_random_state

1455 
1456 def _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha):
1457     alpha = np.asarray(alpha)
1458     if np.min(alpha) <= 0:
1459         raise ValueError("All parameters must be greater than 0")
1460     elif alpha.ndim != 1:
1461         raise ValueError("Parameter vector 'a' must be one dimensional, "
1462                          f"but a.shape = {alpha.shape}.")
1463     return alpha
1464 
1465 
1466 def _dirichlet_check_input(alpha, x):
1467     x = np.asarray(x)
1468 
1469     if x.shape[0] + 1 != alpha.shape[0] and x.shape[0] != alpha.shape[0]:
1470         raise ValueError("Vector 'x' must have either the same number "
1471                          "of entries as, or one entry fewer than, "
1472                          f"parameter vector 'a', but alpha.shape = {alpha.shape} "
1473                          f"and x.shape = {x.shape}.")
1474 
1475     if x.shape[0] != alpha.shape[0]:
1476         xk = np.array([1 - np.sum(x, 0)])
1477         if xk.ndim == 1:
1478             x = np.append(x, xk)
1479         elif xk.ndim == 2:
1480             x = np.vstack((x, xk))
1481         else:
1482             raise ValueError("The input must be one dimensional or a two "
1483                              "dimensional matrix containing the entries.")
1484 
1485     if np.min(x) < 0:
1486         raise ValueError("Each entry in 'x' must be greater than or equal "
1487                          "to zero.")
1488 
1489     if np.max(x) > 1:
1490         raise ValueError("Each entry in 'x' must be smaller or equal one.")
1491 
1492     # Check x_i > 0 or alpha_i > 1
1493     xeq0 = (x == 0)
1494     alphalt1 = (alpha < 1)
1495     if x.shape != alpha.shape:
1496         alphalt1 = np.repeat(alphalt1, x.shape[-1], axis=-1).reshape(x.shape)
1497     chk = np.logical_and(xeq0, alphalt1)
1498 
1499     if np.sum(chk):
1500         raise ValueError("Each entry in 'x' must be greater than zero if its "
1501                          "alpha is less than one.")
1502 
1503     if (np.abs(np.sum(x, 0) - 1.0) > 10e-10).any():
1504         raise ValueError("The input vector 'x' must lie within the normal "
1505                          f"simplex. but np.sum(x, 0) = {np.sum(x, 0)}.")
1506 
1507     return x
1508 
1509 
1510 def _lnB(alpha):
1511     r"""Internal helper function to compute the log of the useful quotient. 
1512  
1513     .. math:: 
1514  
1515         B(\alpha) = \frac{\prod_{i=1}{K}\Gamma(\alpha_i)} 
1516                          {\Gamma\left(\sum_{i=1}^{K} \alpha_i \right)} 
1517  
1518     Parameters 
1519     ---------- 
1520     %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1521  
1522     Returns 
1523     ------- 
1524     B : scalar 
1525         Helper quotient, internal use only 
1526  
1527     """
1528     return np.sum(gammaln(alpha)) - gammaln(np.sum(alpha))
1529 
1530 
1531 class dirichlet_gen(multi_rv_generic):
1532     r"""A Dirichlet random variable. 
1533  
1534     The ``alpha`` keyword specifies the concentration parameters of the 
1535     distribution. 
1536  
1537     .. versionadded:: 0.15.0 
1538  
1539     Methods 
1540     ------- 
1541     pdf(x, alpha) 
1542         Probability density function. 
1543     logpdf(x, alpha) 
1544         Log of the probability density function. 
1545     rvs(alpha, size=1, random_state=None) 
1546         Draw random samples from a Dirichlet distribution. 
1547     mean(alpha) 
1548         The mean of the Dirichlet distribution 
1549     var(alpha) 
1550         The variance of the Dirichlet distribution 
1551     cov(alpha) 
1552         The covariance of the Dirichlet distribution 
1553     entropy(alpha) 
1554         Compute the differential entropy of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1555  
1556     Parameters 
1557     ---------- 
1558     %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1559     %(_doc_random_state)s 
1560  
1561     Notes 
1562     ----- 
1563     Each :math:`\alpha` entry must be positive. The distribution has only 
1564     support on the simplex defined by 
1565  
1566     .. math:: 
1567         \sum_{i=1}^{K} x_i = 1 
1568  
1569     where :math:`0 < x_i < 1`. 
1570  
1571     If the quantiles don't lie within the simplex, a ValueError is raised. 
1572  
1573     The probability density function for `dirichlet` is 
1574  
1575     .. math:: 
1576  
1577         f(x) = \frac{1}{\mathrm{B}(\boldsymbol\alpha)} \prod_{i=1}^K x_i^{\alpha_i - 1} 
1578  
1579     where 
1580  
1581     .. math:: 
1582  
1583         \mathrm{B}(\boldsymbol\alpha) = \frac{\prod_{i=1}^K \Gamma(\alpha_i)} 
1584                                      {\Gamma\bigl(\sum_{i=1}^K \alpha_i\bigr)} 
1585  
1586     and :math:`\boldsymbol\alpha=(\alpha_1,\ldots,\alpha_K)`, the 
1587     concentration parameters and :math:`K` is the dimension of the space 
1588     where :math:`x` takes values. 
1589  
1590     Note that the `dirichlet` interface is somewhat inconsistent. 
1591     The array returned by the rvs function is transposed 
1592     with respect to the format expected by the pdf and logpdf. 
1593  
1594     Examples 
1595     -------- 
1596     >>> import numpy as np 
1597     >>> from scipy.stats import dirichlet 
1598  
1599     Generate a dirichlet random variable 
1600  
1601     >>> quantiles = np.array([0.2, 0.2, 0.6])  # specify quantiles 
1602     >>> alpha = np.array([0.4, 5, 15])  # specify concentration parameters 
1603     >>> dirichlet.pdf(quantiles, alpha) 
1604     0.2843831684937255 
1605  
1606     The same PDF but following a log scale 
1607  
1608     >>> dirichlet.logpdf(quantiles, alpha) 
1609     -1.2574327653159187 
1610  
1611     Once we specify the dirichlet distribution 
1612     we can then calculate quantities of interest 
1613  
1614     >>> dirichlet.mean(alpha)  # get the mean of the distribution 
1615     array([0.01960784, 0.24509804, 0.73529412]) 
1616     >>> dirichlet.var(alpha) # get variance 
1617     array([0.00089829, 0.00864603, 0.00909517]) 
1618     >>> dirichlet.entropy(alpha)  # calculate the differential entropy 
1619     -4.3280162474082715 
1620  
1621     We can also return random samples from the distribution 
1622  
1623     >>> dirichlet.rvs(alpha, size=1, random_state=1) 
1624     array([[0.00766178, 0.24670518, 0.74563305]]) 
1625     >>> dirichlet.rvs(alpha, size=2, random_state=2) 
1626     array([[0.01639427, 0.1292273 , 0.85437844], 
1627            [0.00156917, 0.19033695, 0.80809388]]) 
1628  
1629     Alternatively, the object may be called (as a function) to fix 
1630     concentration parameters, returning a "frozen" Dirichlet 
1631     random variable: 
1632  
1633     >>> rv = dirichlet(alpha) 
1634     >>> # Frozen object with the same methods but holding the given 
1635     >>> # concentration parameters fixed. 
1636  
1637     """
1638 
1639     def __init__(self, seed=None):
1640         super().__init__(seed)
1641         self.__doc__ = doccer.docformat(self.__doc__, dirichlet_docdict_params)
1642 
1643     def __call__(self, alpha, seed=None):
1644         return dirichlet_frozen(alpha, seed=seed)
1645 
1646     def _logpdf(self, x, alpha):
1647         """Log of the Dirichlet probability density function. 
1648  
1649         Parameters 
1650         ---------- 
1651         x : ndarray 
1652             Points at which to evaluate the log of the probability 
1653             density function 
1654         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1655  
1656         Notes 
1657         ----- 
1658         As this function does no argument checking, it should not be 
1659         called directly; use 'logpdf' instead. 
1660  
1661         """
1662         lnB = _lnB(alpha)
1663         return - lnB + np.sum((xlogy(alpha - 1, x.T)).T, 0)
1664 
1665     def logpdf(self, x, alpha):
1666         """Log of the Dirichlet probability density function. 
1667  
1668         Parameters 
1669         ---------- 
1670         x : array_like 
1671             Quantiles, with the last axis of `x` denoting the components. 
1672         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1673  
1674         Returns 
1675         ------- 
1676         pdf : ndarray or scalar 
1677             Log of the probability density function evaluated at `x`. 
1678  
1679         """
1680         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1681         x = _dirichlet_check_input(alpha, x)
1682 
1683         out = self._logpdf(x, alpha)
1684         return _squeeze_output(out)
1685 
1686     def pdf(self, x, alpha):
1687         """The Dirichlet probability density function. 
1688  
1689         Parameters 
1690         ---------- 
1691         x : array_like 
1692             Quantiles, with the last axis of `x` denoting the components. 
1693         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1694  
1695         Returns 
1696         ------- 
1697         pdf : ndarray or scalar 
1698             The probability density function evaluated at `x`. 
1699  
1700         """
1701         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1702         x = _dirichlet_check_input(alpha, x)
1703 
1704         out = np.exp(self._logpdf(x, alpha))
1705         return _squeeze_output(out)
1706 
1707     def mean(self, alpha):
1708         """Mean of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1709  
1710         Parameters 
1711         ---------- 
1712         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1713  
1714         Returns 
1715         ------- 
1716         mu : ndarray or scalar 
1717             Mean of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1718  
1719         """
1720         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1721 
1722         out = alpha / (np.sum(alpha))
1723         return _squeeze_output(out)
1724 
1725     def var(self, alpha):
1726         """Variance of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1727  
1728         Parameters 
1729         ---------- 
1730         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1731  
1732         Returns 
1733         ------- 
1734         v : ndarray or scalar 
1735             Variance of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1736  
1737         """
1738 
1739         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1740 
1741         alpha0 = np.sum(alpha)
1742         out = (alpha * (alpha0 - alpha)) / ((alpha0 * alpha0) * (alpha0 + 1))
1743         return _squeeze_output(out)
1744 
1745     def cov(self, alpha):
1746         """Covariance matrix of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1747  
1748         Parameters 
1749         ---------- 
1750         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1751  
1752         Returns 
1753         ------- 
1754         cov : ndarray 
1755             The covariance matrix of the distribution. 
1756         """
1757 
1758         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1759         alpha0 = np.sum(alpha)
1760         a = alpha / alpha0
1761 
1762         cov = (np.diag(a) - np.outer(a, a)) / (alpha0 + 1)
1763         return _squeeze_output(cov)
1764 
1765     def entropy(self, alpha):
1766         """ 
1767         Differential entropy of the Dirichlet distribution. 
1768  
1769         Parameters 
1770         ---------- 
1771         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1772  
1773         Returns 
1774         ------- 
1775         h : scalar 
1776             Entropy of the Dirichlet distribution 
1777  
1778         """
1779 
1780         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1781 
1782         alpha0 = np.sum(alpha)
1783         lnB = _lnB(alpha)
1784         K = alpha.shape[0]
1785 
1786         out = lnB + (alpha0 - K) * scipy.special.psi(alpha0) - np.sum(
1787             (alpha - 1) * scipy.special.psi(alpha))
1788         return _squeeze_output(out)
1789 
1790     def rvs(self, alpha, size=1, random_state=None):
1791         """ 
1792         Draw random samples from a Dirichlet distribution. 
1793  
1794         Parameters 
1795         ---------- 
1796         %(_dirichlet_doc_default_callparams)s 
1797         size : int, optional 
1798             Number of samples to draw (default 1). 
1799         %(_doc_random_state)s 
1800  
1801         Returns 
1802         ------- 
1803         rvs : ndarray or scalar 
1804             Random variates of size (`size`, `N`), where `N` is the 
1805             dimension of the random variable. 
1806  
1807         """
1808         alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1809         random_state = self._get_random_state(random_state)
1810         return random_state.dirichlet(alpha, size=size)
1811 
1812 
1813 dirichlet = dirichlet_gen()
1814

1816 class dirichlet_frozen(multi_rv_frozen):
1817     def __init__(self, alpha, seed=None):
1818         self.alpha = _dirichlet_check_parameters(alpha)
1819         self._dist = dirichlet_gen(seed)
1820 
1821     def logpdf(self, x):
1822         return self._dist.logpdf(x, self.alpha)
1823 
1824     def pdf(self, x):
1825         return self._dist.pdf(x, self.alpha)
1826 
1827     def mean(self):
1828         return self._dist.mean(self.alpha)
1829 
1830     def var(self):
1831         return self._dist.var(self.alpha)
1832 
1833     def cov(self):
1834         return self._dist.cov(self.alpha)
1835 
1836     def entropy(self):
1837         return self._dist.entropy(self.alpha)
1838 
1839     def rvs(self, size=1, random_state=None):
1840         return self._dist.rvs(self.alpha, size, random_state)
